title: Beer Tumbler, "Prism-cut", ca. 1835
medium: Mouth-blown crystal, faceted and relief-prismatic-cut and polished
provenance: These originals from ca. 1835-1850 are still without the copper wheel-engraved Habsburg crest; this was added as late as ca. 1885/90. The set, for roughly 400 persons, still rests in the "Silver Chamber" in the Vienna Imperial Court Building.
dimensions: H x diam.: 12 x 8 cm (4 3/4 x 3 1/8 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Dale and Doug Anderson, Anonymous Donor, Arthur Liu, and Prairie Pictures, Inc. and from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Mouth-blown crystal, facetted and relief-prismatic-cut and polished

participants.person_name: J. & L. Lobmeyr GmbH, Vienna, Austria
J. & L. Lobmeyr GmbH, Vienna, Austria

tombstone.epitaph:
Beer Tumbler, "Prism-cut", ca. 1835.
ca. 1835. Mouth-blown crystal, faceted and relief-prismatic-cut and polished. Museum purchase through gift of Dale and Doug Anderson, Anonymous Donor, Arthur Liu, and Prairie Pictures, Inc. and from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund. 2009-18-4.
